result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason H. Pennau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with L. Pennau directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.

Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason H. Pennau

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:38 p.m. Defendant Jason H. Pennau in court with attorney Scott Harold Southworth.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2- NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 1,3,4 & 5 - DRI. Statement by the victim. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Southworth. Statement by DE. Court orders: 90 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: DAAP and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, defendant may not be present upon the premises of any bars, defendant is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, No Contact w/ the victim, L.P., Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 3:03 PM: Defendant Jason H. Pennau in court with attorney Scott Harold Southworth, both appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered as to all counts.   ADA argues for $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Statement as to bond conditions by Atty Southworth.  Counsel to conduct informal PTC prior to return.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 11:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
